course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Fundamentals of Organic Chemistry
course.description: Various classes of organic compounds, emphasizing organic chemical reactions and mechanisms of major functionalities and their importance in the area of biological chemistry. For engineering students under the four-year degrees who prefer to learn organic chemistry in a single term.
course.prerequisites: CHEM 1010 OR CHEM 1020

reviews.author: LIFEGOOD
reviews.title: CHEM 2111
reviews.comment_content:
Due to COVID-19, this class was conducted online-mode
same content as previous years.
The first few chapters are relatively easy to understand. I did high school Chemistry but from Chapter 3 onwards (Alkyl Halides), it was very hard to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wei Min Dai is good at explaining, but the pronunciation is quite hard to understand.
He is quite weak in technological skills. e.g.) he was not familiar with some of the Zoom functions.
However, if you ask questions to him, he will try his best to answer your questions. I asked him multiple times, and he explained to me very well.

He also lent me a textbook, I learned a lot from that as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
It used to be closed-book questions, but because of the pandemic, it has been replaced with essays and attendance.

30% for 2 Assignments
70% for 2 Essays
extra 5 points are added according to Attendance.

my score
1st Assignment = 12/15 (Mean = 12.5)
2st Assignment = 14/15 (Mean = 12.9)
1st Essay = 30/30 (Mean = 18.5) - High
2nd Essay = 38/40 (Mean = 23.2) - High
Attendance = never released, but I'm sure I got 100%

My grade = A+

Professor gives us essay questions and we have to answer that question in 600~800 words. It was very hard to get full marks on essays because there are always some points that Professor expects you to write, but many people miss them. Writing within word limit was also challenging. Grammatical mistakes also can deduct your marks.
YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO COPY AND PASTE FROM PPT SLIDES.
reviews.comment_workload:
I took an advantage of the online mode. Because it was an online mode, i only had to study around 1 week before the essay deadline.

4 Essays only for my semester, each with around 1~2 weeks to work. However, the contents are very hard to understand and it may take a lot of time to check your answer. Relatively low workload.

I was happy to see my work paid off.

reviews.author: LSJU
reviews.title: Feedback of CHEM2111
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 6 & 8 Feb
Chemical bonding
Week 2 13 & 15 Feb
Alkanes and cycloalkanes
Week 3 20 & 22 Feb
Acids, bases and alkyl halides
Week 4 27 Feb & 1 Mar
Alkenes and alkynes I: Structure and preparation
Alkenes and alkynes II: Reactions
Week 5 6 & 8 Mar
Alkenes and alkynes II: Reactions (continue)
Stereochemistry
Week 6 13 & 15 Mar
Stereochemistry (continue)
Nucleophilic substitution
Week 7 20 & 22 Mar
Free radicals
Spectroscopy
Week 8 27 Mar
Spectroscopy (continue)
29 Mar
Mid-term Exam
Week 9 3 Apr
Spectroscopy (continue)
5 Apr Public Holiday
Page 2
CHEM2111
12 Apr
Alcohols, ethers, and phenols
Week 10 17 & 19 Apr
Aromatic compounds
Week 11 24 & 27 Apr
Aldehydes and ketones
Week 12 1 May Public Holiday
3 May
Carboxylic acids
Carboxylic acid derivatives
Week 13 8 May
Amino acids, peptides, and proteins
10–15 May, Study Break
Final Examination: 29 May (Monday), 8:3011:30 am, Room 4619 (close to Lifts31/32)

Textbook: "Organic Chemistry, A Brief Course”, by Robert C. Atkins, Francis A. Carey, andChi Wi Ong; McGraw-Hill Education (Asia), 2013.
or "Organic Chemistry, A Brief Course, 3rd Edition”, by Robert C. Atkins and Francis A. Carey;McGraw-Hill; International Edition, 2007.
Solutions Manual: "Student Solutions Manual to accompany Organic Chemistry, A Brief Course,3rd Edition" by Robert C. Atkins and Francis A. Carey; McGraw-Hill; International Edition2007
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor had a slight accent, but quickly adapted to it. And the professor is very enthusiastic and patient. He will answer any questions patiently. Don't be afraid to ask him for advice on anything! But usually there are many students who do not attend. Although this class does not count attendance, I still recommend that you try to attend, because the effect of watching recording will be greatly reduced.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two Assignments (20% of 100 points)
Mid-term Examination (35% of 100 points)
Final Examination (45% of 100 points)

Statistics of letter grades(48 students in total)：
A+: 2
A: 3
A-: 3
B range: 22
C range: 13
D: 4
F: 1

Although the overall grade given in this class is good, I think the A range given in this class is a bit low. Only 16.7%. I can't rule out that this is because the professor thinks the students' level is generally low. In fact, I also think that except for a few students who are very strong in this course, most of them feel that they are not studying properly. I did not play well in the final exam. I only got a lower grade than the midterm. But I still got an A-.
In addition, I think one of the difficulties in this course is that I don't know how to do the questions in the exam. The professor did not give us many practice questions. I borrowed the textbook before the midterm and final exams, and did all the questions after the class. But unfortunately, there is a big difference between the type of questions in the exam and the practice questions after the class. So I didn't learn too much from the questions. I think this is the reason why I didn't get a good grade in the final. I don't know how to prepare for this exam, so if you want to do well in this class, you should find a way to solve this problem.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload, only two assignments.

reviews.author: LMM
reviews.title: self-study course
reviews.comment_content: Most of the lectures before midterms is some high school content and then have little bit harder content afterwards. However, in midterms, the content becomes pretty tricky and you cannot rely on the his powerpoint slides, not enough. You need to look elsewhere such as KhanAcademy, reference book etc. By the end of the course, its include some basic biology of biochemistry stuff. There also are a lot of reactions and conditions that you must need to memorize so not to start studying the day before exams as deadline fighter.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice and knows what he's talking about but he's extremely soft and slow spoken. The slides are a good but details concepts is not very very enough and also see that some pic and content is copy pasted from the book. But if you go to find him with questions about the exams,hw or ...... , he will be happy to explain fully.
Hum, a extra lesson is added on Sat. which because is the teaching speed problem so :(  :{ :[
reviews.comment_grading:
The exam papers are pretty challenging, especially the LQs and little bit MCQs. most people lose a lot of marks in them. There are 2 assignments, a midterm and a final. You can attain a max of 2 bonus points in each assignment to add to your final grade. Without attending a lot lecture, my grades are as follows
Assignment 1- 10.95/10
Assignment 2- 11.9/10
(more marks is bonus)
Midterms- 33.8/35
Finals- 41.5/45

Overall percentage is above 95% and final grade is A+.
just 2 ppl get A+
14ppl is A range
24 ppl in B range
17 ppl in c range
1 d
1 f
total 57 stu.
A range 25.92%
B range 42.11%
C range 29.82%
remain is D and F la
seem fair on B range but no fair to A range guy which should have more A range near to 30%
not is good grade is just nearly to good grade course
reviews.comment_workload: In terms of assignment and midterm and final, workload is quite really low. But you should try to keep up with every week's lecture and not let anything pile up since there is a lot to memorize. The assignments are pretty helpful to prepare for the exams so doing them diligently would be a good idea.

reviews.author: Anisha
reviews.title: a course that you can basically self-study at
reviews.comment_content: Most of the lectures before midterms will initially have high school content and then have advanced content afterwards. However, after midterms, the content becomes pretty challenging and you cannot rely on the powerpoint slides anymore. You need to look elsewhere such as KhanAcademy. By the end of the course, its a lot of advanced biology. There are a lot of reactions and conditions that you just need to memorize so I'd advise not to start studying the day before exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice and knows what he's talking about but he's extremely soft spoken. Put together with a 9 am schedule, you will often see people dozing off. The slides are a good source of guidance but lacks details of concepts and there's often stuff that is copy pasted from the book. But if you go to him with questions about the exams, he's more than happy to explain fully.
reviews.comment_grading:
The exam papers are pretty challenging, especially the MCs. So people end up losing a lot of marks in them. There are 2 assignments, a midterm and a final. You can attain a max of 2 bonus points in each assignment to add to your final grade. Without attending a single lecture after the 3rd one, my grades are as follows
Assignment 1- 9.4/10
Assignment 2- 11.9/10 (1.9 marks is bonus)
Midterms- 24/35
Finals- 31/45

Overall percentage is 76 and final grade is A-.
reviews.comment_workload: In terms of assignment and quizzes, workload is pretty low. But you should try to keep up with every week's lecture and not let anything pile up since there is a lot to memorize. The assignments are pretty helpful to prepare for the exams so doing them diligently would be a good idea.

reviews.author: Eclipse
reviews.title: Not too bad...?
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty standard stuff that organic chemistry course is expected to cover. Topics include:

- Alkanes
- Alkenes
- Halogenoalkanes and substitution reaction
- Nucleophilic substitution
- Free Radical
- Aromatic Compounds
- Alcohols, ethers and epoxides
- Aldehydes and Ketones (Carbonyl Compounds)
- Carboxylic acids
- Carboxylic acid derivatives
- Amino acids, peptides and proteins.

Overall, it is a manageable size of content, with some diligent work placed into it. If you have done IB chemistry, and have done the option of Further Organic Chemistry, that background might help you with the understanding of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really nice person, and he definitely knows what he is talking about. When approached personally, he seeks to answer the questions from the students as clear as possible. However, the fact that the way he teaches is really boring, and having a pretty slow tone of speech doesn't really make him that great of a lecturer. The best bet to doing well is to approach the professor personally to ask him and clarify whatever that you have doubts about.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade breakdown is:

10% Assignment 1
10% Assignment 2
35% Mid-term
45% Final

Since the class is not that big, it seems to be an absolute grading, with the range of:

>= 86% - A+
85.99% - 81% - A
80.99% - 75% - A-
74.99% - 68% - B+

and so on and so forth.

The assignments technically have a little more marks than allocated (he gives 10 mark bonus question which translates to 1% extra) so if you can net those 10% then you can technically get more than 10% for the assignments.

For your info:

Assignments - total of 20.1/20
Mid-term - 26.95/35
Final - 35.4/45
Total - 82.45% - A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy, since the only thing you have to do over the entire course is 2 assignments. The exams have similar difficulty to the assignments, so it is advised to do this assignments diligently.
